channel.title: Nora Shipp on Astro Data Group
channel.description: Recent content in Nora Shipp on Astro Data Group

item.title: Stellar streams around the Milky Way in the Legacy Surveys imaging data
item.description: The stellar halo of the Milky Way is full of debris streams — “stellar streams” — left over from dwarf galaxies and globular clusters that have been destroyed by our Galaxy’s gravitational field. These structures are diffuse, distant, and much lower density than foreground stars in, e.g., the Milky Way disk, which is why they don’t appear if you just plot the sky positions of all stars from a photometric survey like the SDSS or Pan-STARRS.
